nodes.text: Samnel Peers was a TIE fighter pilot with the rank of second lieutenant in the 204th Imperial Fighter Wing of the Galactic Empire. Six months before the Battle of Endor in 4 ABY, Peers was part of a TIE squadron of twelve pilots loaned by the 204th's Colonel Shakara Nuress to the Imperial-class Star Destroyer Sanction for an anticipated Rebel Alliance attack on the Trenchenovu shipyards.

When the attack came, Peers' squadron ambushed the squadron of BTL-A4 Y-wing assault starfighter/bombers which attacked the shipyards, gradually destroying all but one of them. Within the next seven months, Peers and the rest of his squadron were killed in separate missions. The sole rebel survivor from Trenchenovu, Nath Tensent, later confronted Nuress during the attack on the 204th at the planet Pandem Nai wanting to find out the names of the pilots who had killed his squadron. Through Nuress, Tensent learned that all of the twelve pilots, including Peers, were already dead.
Samnel Peers was first mentioned in the 2019 novel Alphabet Squadron, written by Alexander Freed.
